channel.title: Catalyst RSC Emulator
channel.description:
My latest project (had to be done some time)
Basically Catalyst is a new RSC emulator written from scratch, i know well that using RSCD can only go so far. RSCD is single threaded and when i was running with RSCA when we hit around 700 players, it was pretty much at it's peak. Lots of people who play popular servers like RSCA/RSCE usually say that the original RSC felt like it had less lag. That's because technically it did.
RSCD is not event driven and every 40-50ms it will process your data, this means your most likely going to gain an extra 40-50ping than you did with RSC. Then theres the client updater in RSCD which runs at 600ms (which means when you cast a spell, equip an item, you and others will have to wait for this next loop to come around (which could take around half a second plus the latency differences) to actually see your self doing that. This is unnecessary and the 600ms ClientUpdater isn't needed for a lot of the updates it does (it can be sped up a lot, instantly).
Overall this means theres a lot of headroom to decrease latency between the client and server.
Basically the features of this emulator and why people should use it over RSCD is:
Catalyst will be Multi-theaded (more CPU cores = more performance, RSCD would have no improvements using more than 1 core) therefore being able to hold more players and process tasks faster to keep latency lower.
Catalyst will use the Netty framework (from my little research, Netty is faster and less bloated than apache MINA)
Catalyst will be event driven and tasks will be processed instantly
Catalyst will run most of the content (skills, item/object/npc actions etc) as plugins (we will have a website for the emulator, and a plugin-dump where you can share your plugins)
Catalyst will use Python and setup so writing an NPC script, quest or other actions will be a breeze.
Catalyst will focus on optimizing tasks that RSCD didn't to ensure lowest latency possible (to feel fast to the player)
As this emulator is open source and i'm writing it for you guys, not for me. i'm not using this and hosting a server after this. You could say i'm writing this for experience. If anyone has any alternatives to any parts of the server and can provide information on how it would be better, i'll be sure to let you, or myself implement it.
Sometime down the line i'm also going to add character AI. basically i'll be able to load up 2000 'fake' players to be spawned all over the RSC world and run scripts, these might go mine the nearest rock, might wear armor, might talk, open doors, walk around etc. It can be used to stress out the server, and it's a cool little addition to see that many people around.
[b]This project is open source[/b]. You may find the subversion at googlecode: http://code.google.com/p/catalystrsc/
Right now i'm still working on the basics, after i get multiplayer/walking etc done, ill be porting a lot of content over from RSCD and cleaning it up if it needs to be to speed this process up. I will be using all of RSCD's def/locs/formula's and other things that are not necessary to write again. Once i hit a milestone that i'm aiming for, everyone will be able to help develop to make this as close as RSC as possible. It won't have any direct support for PK/point servers unless you highly modify it.
I am for an RSC clone and will continue to update this emulator patching every dupe and exploit possible. Others can help by writing plugins, NPC/object data or even drop data to get this emulator as accurate as possible.

item.title: Catalyst RSC Emulator
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Godandjesus, post:82, topic:352788”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=449104.msg3810953#msg3810953 date=1320897232]

Another description …updated.

[code]
Jagex Library
Here is a list of all the features which our technology already supports:

2D-Graphics
Scrolling background, designable by a map editor. Ideal for platform games, shoot-em-ups etc…
Pixel perfect collision detection.
Replacement java sprite routines, draws lots of small sprites quickly!
Translucent sprites! Great for reflections, explosions and other special effects.
Shadow masks. Give your sprites shadows for more realism.
Resize sprites. Useful for games which are really 2d but still use perspective.
Graduated or translucent rectangles - (Make great menu boxes.)
Blur and greyscale functions.
Screen transition effects - fade or scroll between screens.
Rotate, flip, or skew sprites.
Ripple effect, ripples any sprite horizontally for a watery effect.

3D-Graphics
Uses our super-optimsed engine for fast 3d graphics.
Create huge virtual worlds, potentially thousands of polygons big.
Resize, rotate, or skew 3d objects in real time!
Perspective correct texture mapping.
Gourad shading, helps make objects look more rounded.
Fogging - looks good and hides distant objects for more speed!
Dynamic light sourcing! Change the direction of the light in real-time for cool effects.
Animating textures, e.g A 3D TV could have an animating screen.
3-Dimensional collision detection.
Interlace option - only draws alternate lines for more speed on slower machines.

Music and sound
Play module files as background music! (can replay .mod .s3m or .xm format)
Play up to 64 sounds or instruments simultaneously!
24-bit mixing and sample-interpolation for optimal sound quailty.
Change the volume or speed of the music. Can also fade in and out.
Speed-up or slow-down soundeffects to change pitch.

Multiplayer games
Uses a 2nd java application which runs on your server and controls the game.
Optimised networking routines ensure smooth gameplay.
Chat facility, allows players to talk to each other.
Waiting room where players can meet and challenge each other to games.
Automatic save games - keep track of players scores.
Scoring system & league table - shows the top players.
Multiple rooms allows hundred of games to run simultaneously.
Link multiple games together into 1 program, so player can jump between them easily.
Produce logs and statistics of everything that happens!
Language filter helps prevent unwanted conversation.

Loading/Saving
Compress data for quicker load times. Uses custom compression engine for comptability with all web-browsers.
Script processor - put all the paremeters of the game in one text file so they can be easily altered to change the game, (e.g number of lives, player speed etc…)
Loading bar - shows the loading progress when the applet is run.

Other
Automatic frame insert system - keeps game running at a constant speed across a range of computers, and uses the extra available power for smoother graphics.
Dual-build - The game will run equally well as an applet on a webpage, or as a standalone java application!
Pop-up window - The game can appear in a new resizable window, rather than being embedded in the webpage.
Hiscore table - Uses a perl cgi to automatically save the best players scores. [/code]
[/quote]Where did you find that?

Try internet archive, search “http://www.jagex.com/” and “http://www.jagex.com/runescape.html”[/quote]Touche.

Anyway, I don’t see how that supports the idea of it being event driven…

Read full topic

[code]
Jagex Library
Here is a list of all the features which our technology already supports:

2D-Graphics
Scrolling background, designable by a map editor. Ideal for platform games, shoot-em-ups etc…

Rotate, flip, or skew sprites.

3D-Graphics
Uses our super-optimsed engine for fast 3d graphics.
Create huge virtual worlds, potentially thousands of polygons big.
Resize, rotate, or skew 3d objects in real time!
Perspective correct texture mapping.
Gourad shading, helps make objects look more rounded.
Fogging - looks good and hides distant objects for more speed!
Dynamic light sourcing! Change the direction of the light in real-time for cool effects.
Animating textures, e.g A 3D TV could have an animating screen.
3-Dimensional collision detection.
Interlace option - only draws alternate lines for more speed on slower machines.

Music and sound
Play module files as background music! (can replay .mod .s3m or .xm format)
Play up to 64 sounds or instruments simultaneously!
24-bit mixing and sample-interpolation for optimal sound quailty.
Change the volume or speed of the music. Can also fade in and out.
Speed-up or slow-down soundeffects to change pitch.

Multiplayer games
Uses a 2nd java application which runs on your server and controls the game.
Optimised networking routines ensure smooth gameplay.
Chat facility, allows players to talk to each other.
Waiting room where players can meet and challenge each other to games.
Automatic save games - keep track of players scores.
Scoring system & league table - shows the top players.
Multiple rooms allows hundred of games to run simultaneously.
Link multiple games together into 1 program, so player can jump between them easily.
Produce logs and statistics of everything that happens!
Language filter helps prevent unwanted conversation.

Loading/Saving
Compress data for quicker load times. Uses custom compression engine for comptability with all web-browsers.
Script processor - put all the paremeters of the game in one text file so they can be easily altered to change the game, (e.g number of lives, player speed etc…)
Loading bar - shows the loading progress when the applet is run.

Other
Automatic frame insert system - keeps game running at a constant speed across a range of computers, and uses the extra available power for smoother graphics.
Dual-build - The game will run equally well as an applet on a webpage, or as a standalone java application!
Pop-up window - The game can appear in a new resizable window, rather than being embedded in the webpage.
Hiscore table - Uses a perl cgi to automatically save the best players scores. [/code]
[/quote]Where did you find that?[/quote]
Try internet archive, search “http://www.jagex.com/” and “http://www.jagex.com/runescape.html”

item.title: Catalyst RSC Emulator
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Andrew Gower has stated that the game engine was fired every 600ms, thus proving not really event driven (at least the game engine…)

Read full topic

item.title: Catalyst RSC Emulator
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:71, topic:352788”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=449104.msg3809098#msg3809098 date=1320732513]

Why do you think RSC was event driven?
[/quote]I don’t know why anyone would think it was…

The reason why they were able to handle that many players was because of their clever implementations. The game was successful because any piece of crap machine could run it, and doing that on such limited hardware required good code, so why wouldn’t they extend that ideology to the server side?

It’s just I’ve seen so many people say RSC was event driven (and that’s why it’s faster than RSCD) over the years but the client suggests otherwise…[/quote]It could have been, but I’ve never seen any reason to think that.

Read full topic

item.title: Catalyst RSC Emulator
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix

[/quote]I don’t know why anyone would think it was…

The reason why they were able to handle that many players was because of their clever implementations. The game was successful because any piece of crap machine could run it, and doing that on such limited hardware required good code, so why wouldn’t they extend that ideology to the server side?[/quote]
It’s just I’ve seen so many people say RSC was event driven (and that’s why it’s faster than RSCD) over the years but the client suggests otherwise…

Read full topic
